context_of_use: The customer wants to purchase products through the system by browsing, searching, viewing details, adding to cart, checking out, and tracking orders.
stakeholders_and_interests: customer: wants to efficiently purchase products
payment gateway: wants to process payments securely
inventory management system: wants to maintain accurate stock levels
description: This use case supports the customer in purchasing products by enabling browsing, searching, viewing product details, adding items to the cart, checking out, and tracking orders.
triggering_event: The customer initiates the purchase process.
preconditions: The customer is logged into the system.
The customer has access to the product catalog.
postconditions: The customer successfully completes the purchase.
The order is recorded in the system.
assumptions: The customer has a valid account.
The system has products available for purchase.
requirements_met: The system shall allow customers to browse products by category.
The system shall allow customers to search for products by keyword.
The system shall allow customers to view product details.
The system shall allow customers to add products to their cart.
The system shall allow customers to checkout using multiple payment methods.
The system shall allow customers to track their orders.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on payment methods supported during checkout.
main_flow: 1. customer browses products → system displays products by category.
2. customer searches for products → system returns search results.
3. customer views product details → system shows detailed information about the product.
4. customer adds product to cart → system updates the cart with the selected product.
5. customer checks out order → system processes the payment and confirms the order.
6. customer tracks orders → system provides the delivery status of the order.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 1): If the customer applies a filter, the system displays filtered products.
AF-2 (from Step 2): If no products match the search, the system informs the customer with a 'no results' message.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 5): If payment fails, the system notifies the customer and prompts for a different payment method.
